entry.value: Filter can be used to apply lift, gain and gamma correction to luma values of image.

col.value: How to visualize the area described by the spline
existing alpha mask, mask generated by this filter
existing alpha mask, mask generated by this filter
use area inside of spline (0) or the outside (1)
'amount of feathering (radius of "average" blur applied on mask)'

entry.value: A separable 2D blur implemented by a combination of mipmap filtering and convolution (essentially giving a convolution with a piecewise linear approximation to the true impulse response).

"There are many different effects that go under the name of \"diffusion\", seemingly all of the inspired by the effect you get when you put a diffusion filter in front of your camera lens. The effect most people want is a general flattening/smoothing of the light, and reduction of fine detail (most notably, blemishes in people's skin), without ruining edges, which a regular blur would do. We do a relatively simple version, sometimes known as \"white diffusion\", where we first blur the picture, and then overlay it on the original using the original as a matte."
Cut out the highlights of the image (everything above a certain threshold), blur them, and overlay them onto the original image.
A simple lift/gamma/gain effect, used for color grading.

When used in some transitions this will cause this video to be mixed with the other video. If the video this is applied to already has an alpha channel, then this preserves that by multiplying the opacity level with the alpha channel. This filter is especially handy when used in conjunction with movit.overlay. You can also use this to fade a clip from and to black.
Adjust the opacity of an image through the alpha channel.

col.value: When this is less than zero, the alpha component of the Movit multiply effect follows opacity. Otherwise, you can set this to another value to control the alpha component independently. If you set this to 1, then the opacity parameter can be used to fade to and from black.

entry.value: Change the coordinates and scale to fit within a rectangle.

col.value: Determines whether the image aspect ratio will be distorted while scaling to completely fill the geometry rectangle.
Determines whether the image will be scaled up to fill the rectangle or whether the size will be constrained to 100% of the profile resolution.
Set the horizontal alignment within the geometry rectangle.
Set the vertical alignment within the geometry rectangle.

entry.value: A simple desaturation/saturation effect. We use the Rec. 709 definition of luminance (in linear light, of course) and linearly interpolate between that (saturation=0) and the original signal (saturation=1). Extrapolating that curve further (ie., saturation > 1) gives us increased saturation if so desired.

"Deconvolution Sharpen is a filter that sharpens by way of deconvolution (i.e., trying to reverse the blur kernel, as opposed to just boosting high frequencies), more specifically by FIR Wiener filters. It is the same algorithm as used by the (now largely abandoned) Refocus plug-in for GIMP, and I suspect the same as in Photoshop's Smart Sharpen filter. The effect gives generally better results than unsharp masking, but can be very GPU intensive, and requires a fair bit of tweaking to get good results without ringing and/or excessive noise."
A circular vignette, falling off as cos of the distance from the center (the classic formula for approximating a real lens).
Color correction in LMS color space.

col.value: The specification for a producer to act as the background image.
A property and its value to apply to the producer.
'A property and its value to apply to the transition. This is the primary means to use this filter. See the "affine" transition for details.'
"Use the profile's video resolution when requesting the image from the filter's producer instead of the resolution requested by the consumer."

entry.value: Overlay dynamic text onto the video

col.value: %M:%S %p#" shows only the time in 12-hour format.
A set of X/Y coordinates by which to adjust the text.
The size in pixels of the font.
The width of the outline in pixels.
The number of pixels to pad the background rectangle beyond edges of text.

Set the vertical alignment within the geometry rectangle.

entry.value: Dynamically correct audio loudness as recommended by EBU R128.

col.value: The target program loudness in LUFS (Loudness Units Full Scale).
The duration of time in seconds over which the loudness is calculated.
The maximum amount that the gain will be increased by the filter.
The maximum amount that the gain will be decreased by the filter.
The program loudness measured on the input over the duration of the window.
The amount of gain applied to the last frame. Updated with each new frame.

The number of times the filter has reset the loudness measurement. The measurement is reset whenever the filter detects a discontinuity in the frame sequence. It also resets when it detects that the producer has changed.

entry.value: A simple lift/gamma/gain effect, used for color grading.
Correct audio loudness as recommended by EBU R128.

col.value: Set after analysis. Used during application. Loudness information about the original audio. When results are not supplied, the filter computes the results and stores them in this property when the last frame has been processed.
Used during application. The target program loudness in LUFS (Loudness Units Full Scale).

entry.value: Measure audio loudness as recommended by EBU R128.

col.value: Whether to calculate the peak sample level.
Whether to calculate the true peak level.
The measured program loudness since the last reset.
The measured loudness range since the last reset.
The measured peak sample value for the last frame that was processed.
The measured peak sample value that has been received since the last reset.
The measured true peak value for the last frame that was processed.
The measured true peak value that has been received since the last reset.
Reset the measurement. Automatically resets back to 0 after the reset is complete.
The number of times the measurement has been reset. The filter is reset whenever reset is set to 1 or whenever a parameter is changed.
The number of frames that have been processed since the last reset.
Luma value that defines the center point of transition from prelevel to postlevel opacity value.
Opacity value before the transition in opacity value begins.
Opacity value after the transition in opacity value ends.

entry.value: Apply a color tint. Default values give a sepia tone like an old photograph.

col.value: A set of X/Y coordinates by which to adjust the text.
The size in pixels of the font.

The number of pixels to pad the background rectangle beyond edges of text.

entry.value: Overlay a timer onto the video. The timer can count up or down.

col.value: The time format of the overlaid timer text.
"The time that the timer will start counting up or down. The text will be frozen at 00:00:00.000 from the start of the filter until the start time has elapsed. Must be in the format HH:MM:SS.SSS"
"The maximum elapsed duration of the timer after the start time has elapsed. The text will be frozen at the duration time after the duration has elapsed. Must be in the format HH:MM:SS.SSS"

"An offset to be added to the timer value. When the direction is \"down\", the timer will count down to \"offset\" instead of 00:00:00.000. When the direction is up, the timer will count up starting from \"offset\". Must be in the format HH:MM:SS.SSS"
"Whether the counter should count up from 00:00:00.000 or down from the duration time."
A set of X/Y coordinates by which to adjust the text.
The size in pixels of the font.
The width of the outline in pixels.
The number of pixels to pad the background rectangle beyond edges of text.
Set the horizontal alignment within the geometry rectangle.
Set the vertical alignment within the geometry rectangle.
The low end of the frequency range to be used to influence the image motion.
The high end of the frequency range to be used to influence the image motion.
The minimum amplitude of sound that must occur within the frequency range to cause the image to move. motion.
Oscillation can be useful to make the image move back and forth during long periods of sound. A value of 0 specifies no oscillation.

The number of samples that the FFT will be performed on. If window_size is less than the number of samples in a frame, extra samples will be ignored. If window_size is more than the number of samples in a frame, samples will be buffered from previous frames to fill the window. The buffering is performed as a sliding window so that the most recent samples are always transformed.

The number of samples that the transform will be performed on. If window_size is less than the number of samples in a frame, extra samples will be ignored. If window_size is more than the number of samples in a frame, samples will be buffered from previous frames to fill the window. The buffering is performed as a sliding window so that the most recent samples are always transformed.
The width of each bin in Hz.
The number of bins that are output from the transform.

Adjust the brightness and opacity of the image.

col.value: When this is less than zero, the alpha factor follows the level property. Otherwise, you can set this to another value to adjust the alpha component independently. No alpha channel adjustment occurs if this is not set or it equals 1.

entry.value: Copy one audio channel to another.

col.value: Swap the two channels instead of duplicating the source channel.

entry.value: Copy one audio channel to another.

col.value: Swap the two channels instead of duplicating the source channel.

entry.value: This filter is meant to be included as a normalizing filter attached automatically by the loader so that cropping occurs early in the processing stack and can request the full resolution of the source image. Then, a second instance of the filter may be applied to set the parameters of the crop operation.
Remove pixels from the edges of the video.

Whether to automatically crop whatever is needed to fill the output frame and prevent padding.
When center crop is enabled, offset the center point.

entry.value: Applies a luma transition between the current and next frames. Useful for transitions from a slideshow created using producer pixbuf.

The duration between iterations of the transition. For best results set this to a multiple of ttl used in pixbuf.
'All properties beginning with "luma." are passed to the encapsulated luma transition. For example, luma.out controls the duration of the wipe.'

Properties to set on the encapsulated filter

"The ending rectangle is given in the format X/Y:WxH[:PWxPY] where PWxPY is the size of the averaging region in pixels."

col.value: 3 for left fade, -4 for right fade.
"For stereo: 0 for front left, 1 for front right, -1 for front balance. For quad: 2 for back left, 3 for back right, -2 for rear balance,"
Whether to gang together the front and back when using balance or to gang together the left and right when using fade.

entry.value: Apply one or more filters to a region of the video image. The region can be shaped as well using the alpha channel of another producer.

col.value: 'A file whose alpha channel will "shape" the region. The string "circle" is a shortcut but it requires pixbuf with the librsvg loader. The circle is automatically stretched to the region to create an ellipse.'

entry.value: Process audio using a SoX effect.

col.value: 'If the effect name is "analysis" then it does not run any effect. Instead, it analyzes the audio to determine a normalized gain level. The results are put into the level, peak, and gain properties as well as this effect property as the parameter to the vol effect.'

'Normalize the volume to the specified amplitude. The normalization may be indicated as a floating point value of the relative volume with 1.0 being maximum. The normalization may also be indicated as a numeric value with the suffix "dB" to set the amplitude in decibels.'
Use peak signal level instead of RMS (root mean square) power level to compute gain for normalization.

This computes the gain for normalization dynamically per frame, but it uses a sliding smoothing window to prevent the gain from fluctuating wildly. Currently, this must be used in combination with some SoX effect.
With dynamic normalization, this puts a maximum limit on the amount of gain.

entry.value: An audio visualization filter that draws an audio waveform on the image.

col.key: as 0xrrggbbaa. Colors can also be the words
To create a gradient, define more colors
as 0xrrggbbaa. Colors can also be the words
By default, the filter has one color defined

col.value: The thickness of the line used to draw the waveform.
The rotation angle to be applied to the waveform.
Whether the area under the waveform should be filled in.

The duration of the audio (in ms) to be drawn in the waveform. If the window is less than the duration of a frame, the duration of a frame will be used. If the window is more than the duration of a frame, samples will be buffered from previous frames to fill the window. The buffering is performed as a sliding window so that the most recent samples are always transformed.

'If an end size is provided, then this is the starting size, and size is interpolated over the duration of the filter from start to end size. If the keyframable property "blur" is provided, then this is ignored, and "blur" is used instead. This parameter also affects the size both horizontally and vertically simultaneously, in amounts proportional to the horizontal size and vertical size parameters.'
If this value is set the start and end parameters are ignored.

If this value is set the start and end parameters are ignored.

entry.value: Dan Dennedy, Marco Gittler, and Steve Harris

'This filter provides the amplitude level as a percentage value in floating point. This does not do any "slowing" of the data by averaging out peaks and troughs of short duration like a VU meter. Applications can also get this data on the frame as meta.media.audio_level.<N> where <N> is the channel number starting with 0.'

col.value: <N> is the channel number starting with 0. This is updated on every frame with audio.

entry.value: "Adjust an audio stream's volume level. This filter is based on the 'normalize' utility"

col.value: The number of video frames over which to smooth normalisation.
A floating point or decibel value of the maximum gain that can be applied during normalisation.
A floating point or decibel value of the maximum gain that can be applied during normalisation.
'The animated value of the gain adjustment in dB. Properties "gain" and "end" are ignored if this is set.'
